result.execSummary:
The defendant Elmer Santiago Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Flee Or Elude An Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center.
Court authorizes transfer to Washington County as to the entire sentence.

miscConds.notes: AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department. Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens at least 1 time per month.

No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end probation: all mandatory court costs, fees, assesmsents and surcharges including DNA. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.
Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Elmer Santiago Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Elmer Santiago Jr in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for Elmer Santiago Jr.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting 

Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

The Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, with credit for 18 days time served. Huber release to be determined by HOC staff and Day Reporting Center.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 1 YEAR probation. 
Court authorize transfer to Washington County as to the entire sentence.


Conditions of Probation:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute sobriety.
- DNA sample.
- No possession of controlled substances/alcohol without a valid prescription.
- Random urine screens at least 1 time per month.
- No possession of firearms/ammunition/magazines/holsters/body armor. 
- Pursue full time/part time employment and/or education.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including DNA).

20 day appeal rights given,
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his/her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instructions, filed.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Elmer Santiago not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has offer and discovery. Case is adjourned.  Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jason A Findling in court, defendant Elmer Santiago not in court, in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requested time to meet with defendant.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Elmer Santiago in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Defendant Elmer Santiago in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of Greenfield Officer E. Mocco.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.   Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Elmer Santiago not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Elmer Santiago in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Elmer Santiago in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Elmer Santiago appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
